attributes.action: Force a general election as the UK population are not being represented any more
attributes.additional_details: In recent history the elected government have lost control of business in the house and parliament are now forcing their own interests in the house. We the public of the United Kingdom are not being listened to by our local representatives. there are a small minority of MP's who are honouring their constituencies however the view inside the M25 in more valuable than the entire country. Those MP's have lost the confidence of those who elected them. the only way to solve this is general election
attributes.background: The public of the united kingdom have lost confidence in our Elected constituency representatives. we feel that we need to force a general election to resolve both the brexit crisis but also hold our MP's to account. they no longer serve their constituencies and only serve their own interests.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because it's very similar to petitions we already have open. 
 
You might like to sign and share one or more of these petitions. 

Have another general election  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/235480

Hold a General Election in April 2019.  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/235071

If Theresa May resigns as Prime Minister a general election must be held.  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/252449
